section.title: Request Schema
section.para: Please go here to view the entire RFT transfer request schema documentation.

section.title: General Options
section.para: These options are set in the transferRequest and deleteRequest elements and apply similarly for each.

listitem.para: This denotes number of files in the request that needs to be transferred at one time.
Maximum number of attempts after transient errors to execute the transfer or deletion before giving up and raising an error.
(Not Implemented) In future versions of RFT this will be used to enforce time constraints on a transfer.

section.title: Transfer Options
section.para: These options are set in the rftOptions element (see RFTOptionsType for more details) and are specific to file transfers. They can be specified as defaults for all transfers under the transferRequest element, and/or individually under each transfer element (see TransferType for more details):

listitem.para: Transfer as a binary file. Default is "true".
Specifies the size of the data blocks to use in the transfer.
Specifies the TCP buffer size used for the transfer.

If set to "true", third-party transfer mode will not be use. Instead, a client thread will be started that will GET data from the source server and and PUT data to the destination server. Default is "false".
Specifies the number of parallel streams to use during the transfer. Default is 1.
Specifies whether or not to use data channel authentication. Default is true.
Specifies the credential subject to use for authenticating both the source and destination servers.
Specifies the credential subject to use for authenticating the destination server.
Specifies the credential subject to use for authenticating the source server.
Specifies the username to be used to perform the transfer which sometimes may not be the same as transfer requester.

section.title: Deletion Options
section.para: These options are set in the deleteOptions element (see DeleteOptionsType for more details), and are specific to file deletions. They can be specified as defaults for all deletions under the deleteRequest element, and/or individually under each deletion element (see DeleteType for more details):

listitem.para: Specifies the credential subject to use for authenticating the target server.
Specifies the username to be used to perform the deletion.
